augments.name: Additional Manipulator
augments.description: The addition of a segmented tentacle-like appendage can be useful in situations where the Traveller requires a third hand. Made from polymer plastics and non-ferrous alloys, the appendage is attached between two of the Traveller's ribs, along the lateral side of their body. The appendage can collapse or extend from twenty centimeters to a full meter in length, and has effective STR 6 and DEX 10. It is only a few centimeters in circumference, but ends in a tiny collapsible claw capable of remarkable manual control Only one additional manipulator can be added to each side of the body without restricting lung capacity.
augments.special: Adds another appendage with STR 6 and DEX 10.

augments.name: All-Temperature Epidermal Symbiote
augments.description: This bionic augment is a lifeform related to both viruses and bacteria, and is injected into the Traveller's body. Sweating is the body's temperature regulation system, but it normally has limitations. By adding this augment, the Traveller produces several varying levels of chemical sweat both cooling down and heating up the body according to what is required to remain a perfect body temperature.
augments.special: A Traveller with this augment does not feel the effects of cold or heat in a variance from -30 degrees to 50 degrees Celsius, though it is totally ineffective in temperatures outside of this range. It also reduces the amount of liquid consumption required per day be 20%, and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Aslan Cyber-Claw
augments.description: The jointed metacarpal of the Traveller is replaces by a cybernetic mechanism and polymer sheath holding a retractable claw. With a subtle flick of the wrist the mechanism locks or unlocks the three-inch long steel claw, allowing it to be used as a deadly weapon.
augments.special: Grants the Traveller a Melee weapon that deals 1D+1 damage.

augments.name: Assisted Ambulation
augments.description: By adding tiny stimulatory conduits in the brain and certain muscles and tendons, a Traveller's body can be 'programmed' to function more efficiently and for longer. Using electricity generated from an internal battery system which recharges itself through the Traveller's own diet, the body can function at peak physical capability for hours longer than normal.
augments.special: The Traveller requires three times the normal food intake, but can operate normally on just four hours of sleep.

augments.name: Assisted Ambulation
augments.description: By adding tiny stimulatory conduits in the brain and certain muscles and tendons, a Traveller's body can be 'programmed' to function more efficiently and for longer. Using electricity generated from an internal battery system which recharges itself through the Traveller's own diet, the body can function at peak physical capability for hours longer than normal.
augments.special: The Traveller requires twice the normal food intake, but can operate normally on just two hours of sleep.

augments.name: Assisted Ambulation
augments.description: By adding tiny stimulatory conduits in the brain and certain muscles and tendons, a Traveller's body can be 'programmed' to function more efficiently and for longer. Using electricity generated from an internal battery system which recharges itself through the Traveller's own diet, the body can function at peak physical capability for hours longer than normal.
augments.special: The Traveller requires +50% the normal food intake, but can operate normally on just one hour of sleep.

augments.name: Autonomous Locomotion Rig (ALR)
augments.description: A strange but useful augment, the ALR is a series of hardwired connections from the spine to legs of the Traveller. The Traveller can 'program' his legs to carry him to a specific location set by remote, regardless of his state of consciousness. Tired, wounded, drunk, or even asleep; the ALR will force the Traveller's legs to walk to the specified location. The ALR automatically stops to avoid collisions with dangerous objects (such as moving traffic or sheer cliffs).
augments.special: Allows a Traveller to walk places regardless of his state of consciousness.

augments.name: Ballistic Tracking Lenses
augments.description: The Traveller's retinas are laced with tiny receptors, placing an outline over any object the Traveller aims a weapon at. The Traveller's eyes will shine strangely in direct lighting, revealing the BTLs to observers.
augments.special: BTLs (as they are called) grant the Traveller DM+1 on all ranged attacks where he can physically see the target, but cannot be combined with scopes or other sighting aids.

augments.name: Bio-Fusion Power Port
augments.description: This cybernetic augment is a small caloric generator built into the rib cage of the Traveller.
augments.special: So long as the Traveller consumes 15,000 calories daily, the power port will produce enough energy to serve as a power source for an energy pistol.

augments.name: Cardio-trigger Detonator
augments.description: The cardio-trigger detonator, or 'dead man's bomb' as it is frequently called, is not normally an augmentation a Traveller will willingly choose to have installed. Typically used by terrorist organizations, rogue governments, and (rarely) the occasional sociopath, this augment ties a single explosive device to the heart rate of the Traveller. If the Traveller's heart ever stops, the bomb detonates 2D seconds later. The Tech Level and cost of the cardio-trigger detonator is reliant upon the type of explosive used, adding +1 to the device's Tech Level and multiplying its cost by ten.
augments.special: If the Traveller's heart ever stops, the bomb detonates 2D seconds later.

augments.name: Cockpit Sensory Suite
augments.description: An augment sometimes given to high-G fighter pilots and other fast-vehicle drivers, this alteration thickens the membranes of the eye, speeds hand-to-eye coordination, and enhances blood flow to the brain when under high pressure or stress.
augments.special: This augment grants DM+1 to all Pilot, Drive, and Seafarer checks made when travelling at high speeds.

augments.name: Cognitive Augmentation
augments.description: Replacing slow nerve cells with faster synthetic substrates and implanting optoelectronic boosters can increase the speed at which a Traveller thinks, effectively boosting his intelligence.
augments.special: INT +1

augments.name: Cognitive Augmentation
augments.description: Replacing slow nerve cells with faster synthetic substrates and implanting optoelectronic boosters can increase the speed at which a Traveller thinks, effectively boosting his intelligence.
augments.special: INT +2

augments.name: Cognitive Augmentation
augments.description: Replacing slow nerve cells with faster synthetic substrates and implanting optoelectronic boosters can increase the speed at which a Traveller thinks, effectively boosting his intelligence.
augments.special: INT +3

augments.name: Combat Arm
augments.description: One of the first combat implants developed, the basic cybernetic combat arm is an armored metallic limb designed for combat. Noticeably oversized compared to a human arm, this augment grafts to the existing bone structure of the Traveller and is powered by small power cells, keeping the arm active for three hundred standard hours before needing to be recharged.
augments.special: Gives a Traveller an arm that is STR 12, grants a +2 bonus to Armor, and can be fitted with any melee weapon at +10% more than the weapon's standard cost.

augments.name: Combat Arm
augments.description: The combat arm is constructed from metal and polymer plastics around a more efficient mechanical core. Still larger than a human arm, this augment is fully attached to the nervous and skeletal structure of the user and is fuelled by the user's own biomass energy supply. Any pistol integrated in the arm will have an external port for magazines or power packs.
augments.special: Gives a Traveller an arm that is STR 15, grants a +4 bonus to Armor, and can be fitted with any melee or pistol weapon at +10% more than the weapon's standard cost.

augments.name: Combat Arm
augments.description: The combat arm is slimmer and is made almost completely from non-ferrous alloys, advanced plastics, anc super-conductive circuits.
augments.special: Gives a Traveller an arm that is STR 18, grants a +6 bonus to Armor, and can be fitted with any melee or pistol, weapon at +10% more than the weapon's standard cost.

augments.name: Complex Cranial Processing Unit
augments.description: Effectively a biological computer integrated with higher brain functions, this processing unit automatically activates when the Traveller begins considering complex calculations.
augments.special: Grants DM+1 to all checks (typically Science-related) that involve complex maths.

augments.name: Enhanced Mobility
augments.description: The Traveller has their legs modified to move faster and with greater stability. This augment adds 1.5 meters to the distance the Traveller can move with a Minor Action. Additionally, all checks based on balance or ambulatory reflexes ar made with DM+1.
augments.special: Adds 1.5 meters to the distance the Traveller can move with a Minor Action, and grants DM+1 to all checks based on balance or ambulatory reflexes.

augments.name: Enhanced Mobility
augments.description: The Traveller has their legs modified to move faster and with greater stability. In addition, internal chemical pumps and fatigue-resistant fibres are added, greatly increasing ground speed and agility.
augments.special: Adds 3 meters to the distance the Traveller can move with a Minor Action, and grants DM+2 to all checks based on balance or ambulatory reflexes.

augments.name: Enhanced Mobility
augments.description: The Traveller has their legs modified with superior materials to move faster efficiently and with greater stability. In addition, internal chemical pumps and fatigue-resistant fibres are added, greatly increasing ground speed and agility.
augments.special: Adds 6 meters to the distance the Traveller can move with a Minor Action, and grants DM+3 to all checks based on balance or ambulatory reflexes.

augments.name: Enhanced Vision
augments.description: A Traveller can be implanted with cybernetic eyes giving him the permanent functionality of a set of binoculars and IR/Light Intensifier goggles.
augments.special: Combines the functionality of Binoculars and IR/Light Intensification goggles.

augments.name: Enhanced Vision
augments.description: A Traveller can be implanted with cybernetic eyes giving him the permanent functionality of a set of binoculars, IR/Light Intensifier goggles, and can also see the ultraviolet part of the spectrum.
augments.special: Combines the functionality of Binoculars and IR/Light Intensification goggles. Can also see UV spectrum.

augments.name: Fabulous Augmentation Treatment
augments.description: This full-scale treatment concentrates on the head, but the whole body is considered in a holistic fashion, and makes the Traveller simply fabulous. Small adjustments are made to the Traveller's figure and posture, facial features are adjusted, and the social interaction areas of the brain are biologically enhanced.The effect is to make the Traveller a delight in any social function. A lot of higher-class socialites often seem as though they are just better people than those below them - this treatment is why.
augments.special: Grants DM+1 to any check involving social interaction.

augments.name: Full Body Transplant
augments.description: This augment is unique, as it does not add a new ability or extension to the Traveller - it instead places their mental consciousness into a completely synthetic body. Constructed of synthetic organs, flesh, and bone wrapped around a very complex artificial brain, the new body is not alive The appearance of the body looks however the Traveller desires it, but duplicates of oneself are most common.
augments.special: It is an extremely advanced body with the INT, EDU, and SOC characteristics of the implanted Traveller, but has STR 14, DEX 12, and END 15. The new body requires 10,000 calories a day to stay at top efficiency and for each day the body does not meet this requirement, the physical characteristics will drop by one point each until it refuels. Otherwise, the body does not need to breathe or sleep, it does not age, and self-repairs through nano-scientific chemical applications, effectively healing at the normal rate. It is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Internal Auto-Injector
augments.description: This system holds a dose of drugs (decided at time of implant) that is automatically administered according to a predefined trigger event (such as imminent death). More advanced versions can be purchased, with each increase in TL adding Cr10000 to the cost and an additional two doses.
augments.special: Administers a pre-determined dose of drugs according to a predefined trigger.

augments.name: Mechanostatic Scanner
augments.description: This augments one of the Traveller's ears with a manually activated device similar to a communications scanner.
augments.special: When activated, any augmented individuals within twenty meters will give off a traceable buzz audible only to the Traveller.

augments.name: Metastatic Platelet Injection
augments.description: This is an injection of super-powered clotting cells which bond with the body's existing platelet production cells. The platelets reproduce extremely rapidly when active, sealing wounds quickly. The scabs and scars they leave are always a pasty blue color, however, a sign of artificial proteins in their construction.
augments.special: This augment doubles characteristic points gained through natural healing, and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Muscular Bridging
augments.description: Through surgery and a long and painful recovery process lasting 1D weeks, this augment adds thousands of microscopic protein springs to the fibers of the Traveller's muscular system. This makes every muscle stronger and more flexible.
augments.special: Increases the Traveller's STR and DEX by +1, and increases movement by 3 meters per Minor Action. It is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Nerve-Plug Response Rig
augments.description: Similar to the connections used in a neural link, this cybernetic suite consists of six ports implanted down the spine of the Traveller. These ports attach to specifically-designed slave-pins added to any suit of powered armor or battle dress. Adding the slave-pin rigs to the armor adds +50% to the cost of the armor. When the slave-pins are plugged into the Traveller's ports (when they don the armor), it becomes attuned to his natural nervous reactions and movements. Essentially, the Traveller becomes his armor.
augments.special: Grants DM+2 to all DEX-based checks while wearing powered armor or battle dress equipped with slave-pin rigs (+50% cost).

augments.name: Neural Comm (Audio)
augments.description: A neural comm has identical capabilities to a mobile comm, but the cost is much higher as is the required TL.
augments.special: A Traveller can access the capabilities of a neural comm by thought alone, but it still requires an Electronics (comms) check for complicated activities.

augments.name: Neural Comm (Audio/Visual)
augments.description: A neural comm has identical capabilities to a mobile comm, but the cost is much higher as is the required TL.
augments.special: A Traveller can access the capabilities of a neural comm by thought alone, but it still requires an Electronics (comms) check for complicated activities. Computer/0.

augments.name: Neural Comm (Multiple forms of Data)
augments.description: A neural comm has identical capabilities to a mobile comm, but the cost is much higher as is the required TL.
augments.special: A Traveller can access the capabilities of a neural comm by thought alone, but it still requires an Electronics (comms) check for complicated activities. Computer/1.

augments.name: Neural Link
augments.description: A neural link is a more complex form of a neural comm. In addition to providing the capabilities of a neural comm, it also allows the computer system access to the Traveller's nervous system. A Traveller must connect his neural link to a computer system or wafer jack containing Expert software to use the skill.
augments.special: Allows a Traveller to use a wafer jack or computer system to grant him physical skills.

augments.name: Null Skull
augments.description: A dangerous and expensive process to undergo, the Traveller has the majority of the bone tissue in his skull replaced with psionic dampening metals.
augments.special: The Traveller reduces his PSI to 0, but inflicts DM-6 upon any psionic skills used directly against him.

augments.name: Peripheral Vision Enhancement
augments.description: The depth and acuity of standard, far, and mid-peripheral vision is enhanced.
augments.special: Confers a DM+1 bonus to initiative rolls and Recon checks made to spot unusual or hidden objects.

augments.name: Physical Augmentation
augments.description: A Traveller's endurance, strength, or reflexes can be increased in a variety of ways, from replacing motor neurons with faster synthetic cells, to reinforcing bones and replacing organs with tougher vat-grown clones. Augmentations must be purchased for STR, DEX, or END separately, and only one augmentation for each characteristic may be installed within a Traveller at any one time.
augments.special: Increases a Traveller's STR, DEX, or END by +1.

augments.name: Physical Augmentation
augments.description: A Traveller's endurance, strength, or reflexes can be increased in a variety of ways, from replacing motor neurons with faster synthetic cells, to reinforcing bones and replacing organs with tougher vat-grown clones. Augmentations must be purchased for STR, DEX, or END separately, and only one augmentation for each characteristic may be installed within a Traveller at any one time.
augments.special: Increases a Traveller's STR, DEX, or END by +2.

augments.name: Physical Augmentation
augments.description: A Traveller's endurance, strength, or reflexes can be increased in a variety of ways, from replacing motor neurons with faster synthetic cells, to reinforcing bones and replacing organs with tougher vat-grown clones. Augmentations must be purchased for STR, DEX, or END separately, and only one augmentation for each characteristic may be installed within a Traveller at any one time.
augments.special: Increases a Traveller's STR, DEX, or END by +3.

augments.name: Prosthetic (Crude)
augments.description: Oftentimes a length of wood to make up for a lost leg or bent hook of metal to serve as a makeshift hand, crude prosthetics are awkwardly inefficient as a replacement. The fitting of a crude prosthetic requires a Difficult (10+) Medic check (1D hours, EDU) or the recipient will die during the procedure. Although these prosthetics allow for the Traveller to replace a limb, they are not utilitarian.
augments.special: Inflicts a DM-2 to all DEX-based checks that require its use, but it is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Prosthetic (Functional)
augments.description: Built with better grade alloys and plastics, these prosthetic limbs and hands are the next best thing to having a real body part.
augments.special: Inflicts a DM-1 to all DEX-based checks that require its use, but it is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Psi-Taps
augments.description: These advanced cybernetic augments look like small crystalline windows mounted on either side of the Traveller's face, just above the temple. A portion of the skull is replaced with extremely durable psi-active crystal stimulating the psionic portions of the brain. A Traveller may have multiple pairs of psi-taps if he can afford them, creating a circle of crystal augments around their skull.
augments.special: Adds +2 to the Traveller's PSI characteristic, up to a maximum of 10.

augments.name: Shrieker-box
augments.description: A replacement to the Traveller's own vocal chords, the shrieker-box is an electronic magnifier and modulator. Incapable of mimicking anything but the Traveller's own voice.
augments.special: Can project a Traveller's voice to the volume of an electronic megaphone. May also create discordant static to unsettle those around him, inflicting DM-1 on all skill checks made by anyone within 15 meters who lacks ear protection.

augments.name: Shrieker-box
augments.description: A replacement to the Traveller's own vocal chords, the shrieker-box is an electronic magnifier and modulator. Capable of mimicking any voice.
augments.special: Can project a Traveller's voice to the volume of an electronic megaphone, as well as mimic any voice. May also create discordant static to unsettle those around him, inflicting DM-1 on all skill checks made by anyone within 15 meters who lacks ear protection.

augments.name: Skill Augmentation
augments.description: The traveller's nervous system is rewired to be more suited to a particular task. A pilot might have his reflexes and sense of balanced improved, for example, while a broker might be made capable of controlling his pupil responses and smelling alien pheromones and skin salinity. A Traveller may have three different skill augmentations at any one time.
augments.special: Grants the Traveller DM+1 when using a specific skill.

augments.name: Soldier's Organ Package
augments.description: A combination of genetic alteration and bionic additions to the organ cavity of the Traveller, this extensive body augment was originally designed to create more efficient soldiers. It adds several redundant organs, improving existing ones and works in concert with the Traveller's biology to make them more efficient than they were before. The genetic and surgical processes are long, requiring 1D months of constant care and medical visits, and a steady supply of anti-depressants, genetic stabilizers, and basic antibiotics. When the process is finished, however, the recipient has all of the following organ structures and the listed effects they grant.
augments.special: Tri-Lung Capacity: Delays suffocation by an additional 15 minutes. Bi-Liver Complex: Grants immunity to alcohol and most ingested toxins. Adrenometer: Allows for thirty-siz hours of wakefulness without penalty on a 6,000 calorie daily intake. Quad-Kidney Cycle: Allows for survival on half normal water consumption. Aortal Heart Bud: Grants DM+2 to all END-based checks.

augments.name: Smuggling Container
augments.description: A portion of the Traveller's body is surgically modified to house a polymer pocket, covered by what appears like normal skin. It uses a trigger, which usually looks like a blemish or scar to open.
augments.special: A secret pocket in the Traveller's body can hold up to 5kg of mass up to 8 inches in diameter. Required a Difficult (10+) Investigate check (1D rounds, INT) to discover the container when closed.

augments.name: Subdermal Armor
augments.description: This augmentation adds a mesh of ballistic fibers to the skin and reinforces bones, effectively providing the Traveller with extra armor.
augments.special: Armor +1, which stacks with other protection and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Subdermal Armor
augments.description: This augmentation adds a mesh of ballistic fibers to the skin and reinforces bones, effectively providing the Traveller with extra armor.
augments.special: Armor +3, which stacks with other protection and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Subdermal Armor
augments.description: This augmentation adds a mesh of ballistic fibers to the skin and organs, and reinforces bones, effectively providing the Traveller with extra armor.
augments.special: Armor +4, which stacks with other protection and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Subdermal Armor
augments.description: This augmentation adds a mesh of ballistic fibers to the skin and organs, and reinforces bones, effectively providing the Traveller with extra armor.
augments.special: Armor +5, which stacks with other protection and is not affected by attacks such as electromagnetic pulses.

augments.name: Terminal Stabilization System
augments.description: This is a complex system that monitors all body functions and upon sensing imminent death, immediately releases a potent mix of chemicals and nanobots designed to keep the Traveller alive, if not completely functional. If this is not sufficient to make the Traveller's END a positive figure, death will still take them.
augments.special: When the Traveller is killed, the terminal stabilization system immediately adds 2D END.

augments.name: Venom Glands
augments.description: This bionic augment requires the insertion of toxic salivary glands into the jawbone of the Traveller, making their saliva a potent necrotic toxin.
augments.special: The Traveller inflicts and additional 1D+3 pints of damage whenever he bites a living creature. The Traveller is immune to his own venom.

augments.name: Wafer Jack
augments.description: A wafer jack is a computer system implanted into the base of the skull that contains a physical data socket and a processor running an interface program.
augments.special: A Traveller with a wafer jack can use Expert programs for tasks relying on INT or EDU by thought alone. Has Computer/2 for Expert programs only, and is always running Intelligence Interface. Storage Rating/4.

augments.name: Wafer Jack
augments.description: A wafer jack is a computer system implanted into the base of the skull that contains a physical data socket and a processor running an interface program.
augments.special: A Traveller with a wafer jack can use Expert programs for tasks relying on INT or EDU by thought alone. Has Computer/2 for Expert programs only, and is always running Intelligence Interface. Storage Rating/8.

augments.name: Weapon Implant (Dagger)
augments.description: One of the Traveller's hands and attached forearm is replaced with a lifelike framework of alloy and polymers which has a secret hinged split built within it. Opening in two halves, from between the middle and ring fingers to the elbow, the implant hides a dagger which is shielded from most scanners (those of TL 12 and lower) The dagger is modified in structure to fit in the implant and operates on nervous impulse, but is otherwise the same as a regular dagger.
augments.special: Hides a modified dagger in the forearm of a Traveller that is shielded from most scanners (less than TL 12)

augments.name: Weapon Implant (Stunstick)
augments.description: One of the Traveller's hands and attached forearm is replaced with a lifelike framework of alloy and polymers which has a secret hinged split built within it. Opening in two halves, from between the middle and ring fingers to the elbow, the implant hides a stunstick which is shielded from most scanners (those of TL 12 and lower) The stunstick is modified in structure to fit in the implant and operates on nervous impulse, but is otherwise the same as a regular stunstick.
augments.special: Hides a modified stunstick in the forearm of a Traveller that is shielded from most scanners (less than TL 12)

augments.name: Weapon Implant (Autopistol)
augments.description: One of the Traveller's hands and attached forearm is replaced with a lifelike framework of alloy and polymers which has a secret hinged split built within it. Opening in two halves, from between the middle and ring fingers to the elbow, the implant hides an autopistol which is shielded from most scanners (those of TL 12 and lower) The autopistol is modified in structure to fit in the implant and operates on nervous impulse, but is otherwise the same as a regular autopistol.
augments.special: Hides a modified autopistol in the forearm of a Traveller that is shielded from most scanners (less than TL 12)

augments.name: Weapon Implant (Laser Pistol)
augments.description: One of the Traveller's hands and attached forearm is replaced with a lifelike framework of alloy and polymers which has a secret hinged split built within it. Opening in two halves, from between the middle and ring fingers to the elbow, the implant hides a laser pistol which is shielded from most scanners (those of TL 12 and lower) The laser pistol is modified in structure to fit in the implant and operates on nervous impulse, but is otherwise the same as a regular laser pistol.
augments.special: Hides a modified laser pistol in the forearm of a Traveller that is shielded from most scanners (less than TL 12)
